headline: Doing Trump's bidding, House GOP leadership endorses Liz Cheney's primary challenger

With regard to the suggestion that the RNC should be in the business of picking and choosing Republicans who ought to be supported, traditionally the view of the national party committee is we support all members of our party regardless of their positions on some issues."

McCarthy's statement comes in the wake of several weeks of controversy over the national Republican Party's censure of Cheney and Rep. Adam Kinzinger of Illinois, the only two Republicans serving on the select committee investigating Jan. 6.

It was only a matter of time before the ever-loathsome House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy bowed to Donald Trump's wishes and endorsed the primary challenger to Rep. Liz Cheney of Wyoming, who is a former member of the GOP leadership team.

"House Republicans were ready for a change when I took over as Conference Chair, and it's resoundingly clear that Wyoming families are too," Stefanik said in a statement Friday morning endorsing Hageman.
